answers.answer:
Refugees from Ukraine in Romania can access various mental health and psychological support services, including workshops, specialized psychological and psychiatric consultations (covering adult, pediatric, and addiction treatment), individual and group therapy, psychosocial support activities, mental health awareness, and psychological first aid. Several organizations also provide referrals to necessary resources.

To find detailed information, please visit the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees` and read under the sections "Psychological support in Bucharest" and "Psychological support in other cities of Romania".
answers.bResponse:
Refugees from Ukraine in Romania can access various mental health and psychological support services, including workshops, specialized psychological and psychiatric consultations (covering adult, pediatric, and addiction treatment), individual and group therapy, psychosocial support activities, mental health awareness, and psychological first aid. Several organizations also provide referrals to necessary resources.

To find detailed information, please visit the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees` and read under the sections "Psychological support in Bucharest" and "Psychological support in other cities of Romania". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees

answers.answer:
Mental health services for refugees and other vulnerable groups in Romania are provided by organizations such as ALIAT Association, Atelier Psy Clinic, Red Cross Romania, Project HOPE, World Vision Romania, Save the Children, Plan International Organization, The International Organization for Migration (IOM), Terre des hommes Foundation, The International Rescue Committee, The Contre la Faim organization, Médecins du monde (France), The Estuar Foundation, Necuvinte Association, and the AMURTEL team.

To find detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees, where you can read under the section for each organization or navigate to the "Other cities" item in the main menu for location-specific support.

To find detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees, where you can read under the section for each organization or navigate to the "Other cities" item in the main menu for location-specific support. answers.answer:
Mental health services are available in cities across Romania, not primarily in Bucharest. While many services are listed for Bucharest, there is also a dedicated section for psychological support in other cities.

To find detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and look for the section titled "Psychological support in other cities of Romania." It instructs you to select the "Other cities" item in the main menu to find information for specific locations.

Yes, psychological and psychiatric services, including psychology, psychiatry, adult psychiatry, pediatric psychiatry, and addiction treatment, can be covered by an insurance company like CNAS through Atelier Psy Clinic.

To find detailed information, please visit the website provided in the original document and look under the section for "Atelier Psy Clinic" within the "Psychological support in Bucharest" section.

The ALIAT Association offers unique workshops for Ukrainian adults to openly discuss the trauma of war and learn how to manage its effects on well-being and mental health.

To find more detailed information, you can visit the original webpage at https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and look under the section for "ALIAT Association". You can also follow their Facebook page or contact them via email at inside@aliatong.ro.

To contact various organizations for psychological support, you can reach out via email or phone: ALIAT Association at inside@aliatong.ro; Atelier Psy Clinic at contact@atelier-psy.ro or 0727880447; Red Cross Romania at andreea.furtuna@crucearosie.ro or +40734449947; Hias at raluca.tomsa@hias.org; Project HOPE at ldaccarett@projecthope.org or 48574765954; World Vision Romania at george_macarie@wvi.org or +40742077901; Save the Children at ioana.tonceanu@salvaticopiii.ro; Plan International Organization at Elena.Dinon@plan-international.org; The International Organization for Migration (IOM) at sboanca@iom.int or +40745016883; Terre des hommes Foundation at oxana.buga@tdh.ch or +40371300390; The International Rescue Committee at katarina.mitic@rescue.org; The Contre la Faim organization at mhpss-hod@ro-actionagainsthunger.org or +40727952538; Organization Médecins du monde (France) at mhpssco.romania@medecinsdumonde.net or +40724494353; The Estuar Foundation at amedeea.enache@estuar.org or +40753088675; Necuvinte Association at ana.popa@necuvinte.ro or +40770165771; and AMURTEL team at +40769 315 111.
